problem_summary_simple: Split a linked list into k parts of roughly equal size, with earlier parts being larger.
problem_summary_technical: Calculate part sizes based on list length and k, then traverse and cut the list into k segments.
key_insights: First, determine the total length of the linked list.
Calculate the base size of each part and the number of parts that get an extra node.
Iterate k times, advancing the pointer and breaking the link at the end of each part.
